name: Blessings of the Frost Moon
desc: You encounter Lauma, who is deep in thought, at the Frostmoon Enclave...

customize.text:
Complete the quest to unlock Joint Meeting Point Construction
Share the Luna Sigils obtained during adventures to construct the Meeting Points together

customize.name: Blessings of the Frost Moon
customize.desc: You encounter Lauma, who is deep in thought, at the Frostmoon Enclave...

customize.name: Adventure EXP
customize.desc: Adventure EXP. Used to improve Adventure Rank.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Hero's Wit
customize.desc:
Character EXP material. Gives 20000 EXP.
These experiences are extremely precious for a pilgrim traveling through Teyvat in order to be closer to Celestia.

customize.text:
Go to the <color=#ece5d8>Frostmoon Enclave</color>
Go to the Moon Mirror
Operate the device(s) within the Moon Mirror
Talk to

customize.name: Lauma
customize.desc: A Maiden blessed by moonlight and the grove alike, hope born to the Frostmoon Scions.

customize.name: Lauma
customize.desc: A Maiden blessed by moonlight and the grove alike, hope born to the Frostmoon Scions.

customize.text: Complete the quest and return to the library at the <color=#ece5d8>Frostmoon Enclave</color> to unlock the additional dialogue with

customize.name: Lauma
customize.desc: A Maiden blessed by moonlight and the grove alike, hope born to the Frostmoon Scions.

customize.text: Note: All interactions can be experienced by teleporting to a different location and returning to <color=#ece5d8>Frostmoon Enclave</color> .

<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Hey Lauma, we're here to visit!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Whoa, what happened here?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: ...This is a lot of stuff.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Yeah, boxes piled up everywhere, some of them opened up, loose items strewn all over the floor... Isn't this supposed to be a library?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Seems more like a storeroom at this point.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Are they doing some more renovations?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Look, Lauma's over there talking to a Weasel Thief... What are they plotting this time? Let's go see.
<color=#ffffff>Weasel Thief:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> *sigh* Be that as it may, we don't have any urgent excavation work for you at the moment... So please, stop digging holes all over the place, alright?
<color=#ffffff>Weasel Thief:</color> ♪
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> That's a good child. Here, this Mora is for you.
<color=#ffffff>Weasel Thief:</color> ♪
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> That's the Weasel Thief from last time, right? What was Lauma saying? Have they found another relic?
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Hello there, Traveler, Paimon. Welcome to the library. Is there anything I can help you with?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: I saw you talking to the Weasel Thief.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Have you found some more buried relics?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> No. I was just giving the little one a bit of a stern warning. It's been getting a little overexcited lately, and it's starting to bother the community.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Its passion for treasure-hunting has only grown since we retrieved the Lunar Semblance... It comes to me all the time, asking when the next treasure hunt will be.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> I keep repeating that we now have more than enough documents and relics in our library to occupy our research, but alas...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: It can't change its nature.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: It went off treasure-hunting on its own?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Yes. But it doesn't quite understand what constitutes a "relic," so it simply digs up anything that seems valuable and drops it off here.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> It has at least promised me that it won't go digging around again, but there's already a big backlog of items from previous digs... There's no way around it. I'll just have to go through and sort them one by one.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Sorry, you two. I'm afraid I won't be able to accompany you on your sightseeing today.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Phew... Now then, what's in this box again...?
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Lauma again
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Phew... Now then, what's in this box again...?

<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Finally, some progress at last. Now to somehow put all these things back where they belong...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> This is quite an eclectic mix...
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> I know... There's petrified seeds of an ancient tree, fossilized animal bones, colorful stones...
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> ...Mora deposit boxes that people buried for safekeeping, wish-boxes, letters with photos enclosed...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Sounds like it grabbed everything it could get its hands on!
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Well, weasel thieves have a different perspective on value from us. It seems like this one just bagged anything and everything that grabbed its attention.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> The seeds and rocks will be easy enough to deal with, but those storage boxes and wish-boxes will have been buried with the express purpose of digging them up at a later date.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Will you need any help?
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Thanks for the kind offer, but I've already engaged another, slightly more mature weasel thief to handle this. It will be in charge of moving all the items back to their original spots.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> After all, the kid's heart was in the right place. Making it put everything back where it found it would break its poor little heart.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> But won't the other weasel thief you hired tell the first one everything?
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Hopefully not. The little one prefers to live on its own and act solo, so they're unlikely to meet.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> It also has a short attention span. Give it half a month, and I'd be very surprised if it still remembers anything it dug up.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: You sure are an expert in animal behavior.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: And you understand their psychology, too.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> I speak their language, and I've had the privilege of their company for a long time. It's only natural that I've come to understand them — no different from making friends.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> By contrast, other people can't understand what animals are saying, so they're bound to make mistakes when trying to understand them.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> That's why, in a lot of literature on the topic, phrases like "bestial nature" are rife with negative connotations, while "human nature" is seen in a more rounded light...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Well, humans are the ones writing the books...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: They can't hear the animals' side of the story...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Heh... You're right. I'm sure those books would have turned out quite differently if they were written by a wolf or a rimehorn deer.
<color=#ffffff>Rimehorn Deer:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> ...In any case, to me, "human nature" and "bestial nature" are both simply "nature."
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Whether human or beast, all have moments of courage and of cowardice, times of both greed and rage...
<color=#ffffff>Puffin:</color> ♪
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> We all rejoice in our successes and mourn our failures... These experiences are neither inherently human nor inherently animal. They are a part of our shared nature — a nature bestowed upon all living things by Mother Nature herself.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> I do sometimes wonder whether the world around us might have turned out for the better if humans and animals could communicate with each other.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> But I know it is but a fantastical idea that can never be.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Then there are those who reject nature, and turn their back on the natural way.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> They are the wayward ones who do not hesitate to pull the trigger, even when they speak the same language as the object of their slaughter.
<color=#ffffff>Rimehorn Deer:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> ...Yes, child. I know you can protect yourself, and that you are far fleeter of foot than they. Do not worry, no one shall harm you again.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Ah, how time flies. I should get back to sorting through that pile of treasure.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> I should have enough time to get everything in order before the weasel thief arrives.
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Lauma again
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> What do we have here...? Ah, that goes in this pile...

<color=#ffffff>Weasel Thief:</color> ♪
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Oh, look, Traveler. There's that weasel thief again, and it's standing right next to Lauma.
<color=#ffffff>Weasel Thief:</color> !!!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Huh? It took off...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Has it seen the error of its ways?
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Come here, Traveler. Our little friend asked me to pass this Mora on to you.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Eh? Why would a weasel thief give Traveler its Mora?
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> As I said, it greatly admires your treasure-hunting abilities, and wishes to join you in unearthing every treasure chest in this world.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Consider this its "deposit."
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Wait, so it was serious?
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> When Mora is involved, a weasel thief never lies.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Keep it safe. This coin represents an agreement between you and the weasel thieves... or at least, this weasel thief.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Digging up treasure's just a side gig for me...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: I'm not actually a professional in this field...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> I wouldn't worry. I know I said it's an "agreement," but I believe it just wants to make friends with you.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> It didn't know what kind of gift you'd like, so it chose to give you its favorite thing.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: ...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: I'll take good care of it.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Please do. If you're interested in taking up the offer, leave some Dried Lakkaberries by your pillow when you get home. It's very fond of those.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Not too many, of course. It might struggle to burrow its way home if it eats too much.
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Lauma again
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> If you're interested in taking up the offer, leave some Dried Lakkaberries by your pillow when you get home. It's very fond of those.

<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> This book belongs... here, I think. Huh, there's one missing. That's strange...
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Hmm, claw marks on the shelf. And feathers...
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> I bet one of the puffins took it to use as a cushion again. Ah, those little rascals...
<color=#ffffff>Puffin:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> I need you to head back into the woods and see if anyone has a book in their nest.
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> If you find it, please bring it back. And tell whoever took it that they can come to me if they'd like a cushion to sit on.
<color=#ffffff>Puffin:</color> ♪
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Phew... We need to make some more cushions... I think we're going to need everyone's help.

<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> There, all better. Next time, if it's too heavy — don't try and lift it.
<color=#ffffff>Longplume Ibis:</color> ♪
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> ...Acting tough isn't going to solve anything. Now, if you injure yourself again, or if there's an emergency, you know where to find me, okay?
<color=#ffffff>Longplume Ibis:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Off you go, now. Oh, actually, one moment...
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Take this twig. I picked it up by the roadside. It seems nice and sturdy.
<color=#ffffff>Longplume Ibis:</color> ♪
<color=#ffffff>Lauma:</color> Of course. And do tell your friends that they're always welcome here if they need a warm place to stay — I know the weather's been quite cold lately.
<color=#ffffff>Longplume Ibis:</color> ♪
